clean up

timeline.bodyText: @akshaysonvane does this look right to you.
timeline.author: bsrikan

replies.bodyText: Looks like @timur-isangulov reverted the change. Files changed is 0.
replies.author: bsrikan

replies.bodyText: To fix incorrect git commits in a PR, rather than having multiple commits like cleanup or revert, I always use git rebase -i HEAD~10 which opens up an editor and I can reword commit messages. There are others like fixup, which is again something I use to squash commits that are merely corrections of an incorrect commit.
replies.author: bsrikan
